explanation: A del credere is an agent who guarantees the solvency of third parties with whom the agent contracts on behalf of the principal.

text: An insurance principle that prevents a person from insuring what he does not stand to lose financially if the insured risk occurs is
explanation: Insurable interest; A principle that states that an insured may not collect more than its own financial interest in property that is damaged or destroyed.

explanation: A voyage policy is marine insurance coverage for possible damage to a ship's cargo.

explanation: Ex-dividend describes a stock that is trading without the value of the next dividend payment.

text: "Not Negotiable" on a cheque means

options.A: ownership can be transferred to the third party by mere delivery
options.B: the cheque can be paid over the counter on endorsement
options.C: the holder has no better title than the person person who transfers it
options.D: ownership rests with the one who issued the cheque

explanation:
A ''not negotiable cheque'' means that if the cheque is transferred to another person, the person who obtains the cheque has no greater rights to it than the person who gave it.
This is simply a warning to whoever has been given the cheque, to verify and ensure that the credentials of the transferor (former owner) of the cheque are intact without defects or irregularities. Because in case the title of the transferor is defective, then the tranferee also gets the same defective title

text: The concept which says that a company's production policy should be centered on the ultimate user of the product is known as
explanation: Consumer sovereignty is an economic concept where the consumer has some controlling power over goods that are produced, and the idea that the consumer is the best judge of their own welfare.

text: The various rights attached to different classes of shares are stated in the
explanation: TheArticles of Association(AoA) is a document that defines the purpose of a company and specifies the regulations for its operations. It states the internal affairs of the company like share of profit. capital contributed, rights of different classes of shares.

text: Which of the following is a feature of supermarkets?

options.B: Specializes in one line of product
options.C: Goods are on display with price tags
options.D: Does not have to provide storage facilities

explanation: One distinguishing characteristics of  Supermarkets is the display of varieties of goods including other non-food items such as medicines, cosmetics, ready-made garments, household goods with price tags clearly stated

text: Public enterprises are financed mainly by
explanation: Public enterprises are financed by direct government finance, in the form of equity, credit, or subsidy capital

text: A personal computer on sale in an office equipment shop is an example of
explanation: stockrefers to the goods on hand which is to be sold to customers. The computer system is a stock

text: The difference between current assets and current liabilities is
explanation: The difference between current asset and current liability is known as working capital which represents operating capital

text: A Ltd. Company has an authorized capital of 2,000,000 shares of D5 each. If the company issued 1,200,000 shares, its issued capital is
The money issued by Ola Maro and Co Ltd. in running the day to day activities of the business is represented by
explanation: Working capital is the capital of a business which is used in its day-to-day trading operations, calculated as the current assets minus the current liabilities.

text: Which of the following is an advantage of a sole trader?
explanation: Sole tradersmaintain full control of their business. Running it how they please without the interference of others. Decisions are made quicker and faster without having to go through the approval of the board

text: A person's deliberate decision to reduce the value of her currency is called
explanation: Devaluation; the reduction in the official value of a currency in relation to other currencies.

explanation: click here

text: Ad valorem duties are based on the
explanation: Ad valorem duty;means according to the value. Import duties or taxes expressed as a percentage of value.

text: A tariff refers to
explanation: Tariff; a tax or duty to be paid on a particular class of imports or exports.

text: The selling of goods in small units is normally performed by
explanation: Retailer; is a person or business that sells goods to the public in relatively small quantities for use or consumption rather than for resale.

text: Direct sales to consumers by manufacturers is a means of eliminating
explanation: middleman: an intermediary or agent between two parties especially : a dealer, agent, or company intermediate between the producer of goods and the retailer or consumer. When a manufacturer sells directly to the consumer, the middlemen are eliminated

text: A physical restriction placed on the quantity of goods that can be imported is
explanation: A quota;a limited quantity of a particular product which under official controls can be produced, exported, or imported.

text: A country is said to achieve a trade surplus when total

options.A: visible exports exceed total visible imports
options.B: invisible exports exceed total invinsible imports
options.C: visible exports exceed total invisible imports
options.D: visible imports exceed total visible exports

explanation: Trade surplus is achieved When the amount by which the value of a country's exports exceeds the cost of its imports.

text: The process of winding up a public limited company by a court order is known as
explanation: Compulsory liquidation is a formal insolvency procedure which results in a limited company being forcibly shutdown by way of a court order.

text: A person who undertakes responsibility for forming a new company is
explanation: Registrar of Companies is a government official whose duty is to ensure that companies are properly registered, and that, when registered, they file accounts and other information correctly.

text: A term which describes the value of business connections made by a company over the years is known as
explanation: Goodwill; the established reputation of a business regarded as a quantifiable asset and calculated as part of its value when it is sold.

text: The ancillary to trade which ensures that people have access to information pertaining to goods is
explanation: Advertising; describe or draw attention to (a product, service, or event) in a public medium in order to promote sales or attendance.

text: The insurance principle of indemnity does not apply to
explanation: The principle of indemnity does not apply to life insurance because, the human being can not easily be evaluated.

text: To take an insurance policy, an applicant must first complete a/an
explanation: Aproposal formis the form completed by the policyholder when applying for insurance. You will need to fill in information about the risk you are insuring e.g. the rebuild cost of your house or type of car you own.
